Class Student

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • ClubAbstractEntity
                • Person
                  • Student
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Student
extends Person
    Student - this class extends the Person Class. It inherites all its basic behaviour and adds another field to it- which are neccessary for the Student.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Student()
      empty constructor that uses the 5 parameter constructor for initialization of a new empty entity.
      Student(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String surname, java.lang.String tel, java.lang.String studentID)
      This 5 parameter constructor calls the parent constructor for initializing the basic Person field, than it initializes the rest (using: ClubAbstractEntity.addToCenter(java.awt.Component), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericStrikeLabel(), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericTextField(java.lang.String), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericRow(java.lang.String, javax.swing.JTextField, javax.swing.JLabel))

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void commit()
      commit simply calls the father's Person.commit() which writes the text fileds to the actual data base.
      boolean match(java.lang.String key)
      Match- will tell us if a given key matches this students actual ID or his StudentID (starting from the 5th index).
      protected void rollBack()
      This method is used for pressing cancel while changing a students information if cancel was pressed nothing should be saved - therefore this method is invoked and makes sure that that the valid data that is already in the database will be set back to the text fields.
      protected boolean validateData()
      This method is used to validate the fields of the students window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Student

        public Student()
        empty constructor that uses the 5 parameter constructor for initialization of a new empty entity.

      • Student

        public Student(java.lang.String id,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String surname,
               java.lang.String tel,
               java.lang.String studentID)
        This 5 parameter constructor calls the parent constructor for initializing the basic Person field, than it initializes the rest (using: ClubAbstractEntity.addToCenter(java.awt.Component), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericStrikeLabel(), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericTextField(java.lang.String), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericRow(java.lang.String, javax.swing.JTextField, javax.swing.JLabel))
        Parameters:
        id - the actual person id of the student
        name - the name of the student
        surname - the surname of the student
        tel - the phone number of the student
        studentID - the studentid of the student

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public boolean match(java.lang.String key)
        Match- will tell us if a given key matches this students actual ID or his StudentID (starting from the 5th index).
        Overrides:
        match in class Person
        Parameters:
        key - a key to match to
        Returns:
        true if the key that was given is equal to the id.

      • validateData

        protected boolean validateData()
        This method is used to validate the fields of the students window. It calls the super's Person.validateData() for the common fields of it and its father. If it went successfuly than we validate the last field - studetID. If a validation of the format failed a red label will appear in the right side of the textfield, if an existing validation failed a message will be shows via NightClubMgmtApp.existsValidate(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, ClubAbstractEntity) method.
        Overrides:
        validateData in class Person
        Returns:
        true if a validation went successfully and false otherwise.

      • commit

        protected void commit()
        commit simply calls the father's Person.commit() which writes the text fileds to the actual data base. than writes the student id to the data base.
        Overrides:
        commit in class Person

      • rollBack

        protected void rollBack()
        This method is used for pressing cancel while changing a students information if cancel was pressed nothing should be saved - therefore this method is invoked and makes sure that that the valid data that is already in the database will be set back to the text fields. It uses the supers Person.rollBack() method.
        Overrides:
        rollBack in class Person
